title: http auth prevents from accessing status.php / clients don't support http auth for accessing the file
body:
hi,

i had troubles with both the android and desktop sync clients with my owncloud installation that requires password authentication using http auth. thanks to your support it was pointed out to me that status.php has to be accessible without authentication. the suggested solution was to remove authentication for this file which indeed fixes the problem with the clients.

however, i think this is not right but a hack. http auth forwarding is supported by owncloud and this is a nice feature (means you provide your http credentials and are directly logged in into owncloud as well). http auth is crucial to protect the owncloud installation _including_ the status.php file as this provides version information that could be used by a malicious hacker to break in (for the same reason apache offers to disable such output all together).

i think the only correct fix for this is that the sync clients support http auth authentication for status.php which is what i'd like to request with this bug report.

if that shouldn't be possible for whatever reason the second best but still (and i would like to stress this) bad solution is to disable authentication selectively for status.php, e.g. by following the suggestion at
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13950207/how-to-make-basic-auth-exclude-a-rewritten-url
this should be included in the default .htaccess file provided by owncloud so that uninformed users don't have to fiddle around with their apache configuration.
